H0.text: Writing a brief report is what the scientist must do in order to have the unexpected conclusion from a firstâ€‘time experiment accepted by other scientists.

H1.text: Repeating the experiment is what the scientist must do when performing a new experiment for the first time and reaching an unexpected conclusion, in order for that conclusion to be accepted by other scientists.

H2.text: Purchase new equipment is what a scientist must do when performing a new experiment for the first time and reaching an unexpected conclusion in order to have the conclusion accepted by other scientists.

H3.text: Make a data chart is what a scientist must do when performing a new experiment for the first time, reaching an unexpected conclusion, in order to have the conclusion accepted by other scientists.

A4.text: If an experiment cannot be repeated to produce the same results, this implies that the original results might have been in error.

A5.text: It is common for a single experiment to be performed multiple times, especially when there are uncontrolled variables or other indications of experimental error.
